topic.title: Create Desktop ZeroNet Client
topic.body: I believe that ZeroNet needs a desktop client. A desktop client would provide a better environment than a browser-based client due to restrictions in browsers. Additionally, a desktop client that autostarts the python script which handles p2p decentralization would provide a better p2p environment.

topic.title: Menu Buttons Disappear on Load
topic.body:
### Environment

  * ZeroNet version: 0.6.5
  * Operating system: MacOS Mojave
  * Web browser: Safari 12
  * Tor status: disabled
  * Opened port: no
  * Special configuration: no

### Problem
Buttons in the top menu on [ZeroHello](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D/) disappear once page is loaded.
![Screen Shot 2019-08-26 at 9 49 08 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37424786/63707464-cf8c6180-c7e6-11e9-9ec7-e11f559c63e0.png)

1604067478_mirrored_dssecret_github.body:
> A desktop client will force us to chose a single rendering engine

I do not believe that is the case. I believe it would just require additional work. However, in most operating systems, there are some rendering engines that are always used (i.e. WebKit and its fork, Blink).

> You can make ZeroNet run at startup

Yes, you can except it isn't very user friendly.
Most people just use Blink or WebKit.
